scenes.text: November 4th 2019
You wake with a fright. The memory of that awful scene still haunts you every night
You go downstairs to get some breakfast. You call for your mother.

You hear a flurry of footsteps, more than one set of feet, which surprises you given your father's recent suicide and that no one else should be in the house. You open the fridge and find a bottle of milk, it's one day past expiry
Your mother walks down the stairs, she looks surprised that you are up. 'Why are you up Jonas?'

options.optionText: It's the first day of school.
I'm going to hang out with Marthat and Bartosz

scenes.text: 'You know you don't have to go to school if you don't want to, you still need time to heal' As she walks by you detect the faint smell of aftershave on her neck, certainly not one that you recognise as belonging to your father.

options.optionText: I need to get out of the house.
Why is the Milk gone off?
Was there someone upstairs with you?

scenes.text: 'Okay, look after yourself' Your mother kisses you on the forehead.
'I didn't get a chance to go to the shop yesterday' Your mother glares at you.
'Wha... What are you talking about?' Your mother spins and glares at you, shaking the coffee container she's holding
'You must be imagining things' Your mother says nervously. 'You still see your dead father walking around, forget it'
You finish your breakfast. Eager to get going, you rush back upstairs and grab your school things and make for the front door.
You hear your mother call out to you. 'Don't forget your yellow jacket, it's pouring outside!'
There is no one at home now
As you approach the Nielsen house you see a middle aged man exit the house. You recognise him as Ulrich Nielsen.
As you approach, Ulrich spies you out of the corner of his eye. He turns and examines you. 'Hello Jonas, shouldn't you be in school?'
'You don't look sick' remarks Ulrich. He stares at you intently for half a second before breaking into a smile. 'I'm only joking Jonas, I won't arrest you today!'
'I understand' remarks Ulrich. 'You've been through a lot these last few months'
Ulrich approaches you and as he does you detect a familiar smell. The aftershave is the same that you smelt on your mother at breakfast

options.optionText: Were you at our house earlier?

scenes.text: Ulrich's eyes suddenly narrow as he glares at you, studying. 'No' he says 'Why would you think that?'

options.optionText: The aftershave, I smelt it on my mother this morning and I heard two sets of footsteps when I called her.

scenes.text: Ulrich leans in close. 'I don't know what games you think you are playing but if you so much as speak a word of this to anyone in my family I'll lock you up in jail for a week.'
Ulrich shoves you against the bonnet of his car. 'Jonas you are under arrest!'
Ulrich eyes you suspiciously before breaking into a smile again. 'Nevermind, Jonas. Why don't you run along to school and talk with Martha and Magnus'
'I have to go into work' says Ulrich, somberly. 'We still have no leads on where Erik is.'

options.optionText: Where do you think he's gone?

scenes.text: 'We don't know, we've searched the forest where he was last seen but have found nothing, as far as we can tell he's just disappeared off the face of the Earth' Ulrich's voice gains a tone of sadness. 'It's like my brother, Mads' case all over again'

options.optionText: He disappeared 33 years ago didn't he?

scenes.text: 'Yes, the circumstances seem to match up nearly exactly. It's very strange' Ulrich ponders this for a moment. 'Anyway, I must go.'
'See you around Jonas' Ulrich says as he hops in his car and departs.
The door is locked. There is no one home
As you approach the Police Station a short haired, middle aged woman exits the front door. She seems troubled. You recognise her as Charlotte Doppler.
Charlotte looks up from the paper she's holding as she spots you. 'Hello Jonas'. The smile she wears seems forced.
'What are you doing here?' asks Charlotte.

options.optionText: I wanted to ask how Erik's investigation is going

scenes.text: 'Ohh, well you know I can't discuss an active investigation with a civilian.' Charlotte looks curiously at you. 'Why do you ask? Do you know something that could help us?'

options.optionText: Yes, I'd like to confess. I killed Erik.
No I'd just like to know what happened

scenes.text: Charlotte sighs. 'I'm afraid we don't know anymore than what's already common knowledge. Erik left home on the evening of November 1st to go into the forest and he hasn't been seen since.'

'We were told by a few of his friends that he liked to frequent the cave in the middle of the forest but that cave is a maze and I'm afraid if he did go in there that it would be nearly impossible to find him.
'His parents said he was wearing a yellow shirt, blue jeans and a necklace with a blue pendant on the end. So, if you see someone matching that description, please tell us immediately'
'I have to go Jonas, I have more witnesses to question' Charlotte hurriedly walks off.
The station is closed.
You enter the forest, the terrain is mostly easy and forgiving. The forest appears empty, you hear only the odd chirps of birds.
You continue strolling through the forest for a few minutes when you hear a branch break somewhere in the distance.
As you approach the noise you began to make out a familiar figure, Martha Nielsen
Martha hears you as you approach and looks up from the book in her hand to catch your gaze.
'Jonas!' She jumps up from the stump she's sitting in and runs to you open armed. Before you know it she has you in a tight embrace.
'I missed you so much all summer! It just wasn't the same without you around'

options.optionText: I needed space from this place

scenes.text: Martha stares at you quizzingly. 'Where were you? Bartosz said you were in France but I know that was bullshit.'

options.optionText: I was in Frace visiting relatives
I was in a psychiatric hospital

scenes.text: Martha frowns. 'You're not convincing me. Why can't you just tell me where you really were? I know it was hard after your dad died but I could've helped and been there for you but you just shut me out!'

options.optionText: I was in a psychiatric hospital

scenes.text: 'Fine, don't tell me, hide secrets. I thought we were closer than that.' A tear comes to Martha's eye as she storms off.
'What?' Martha asks disbelieving. 'No, it makes sense, you were so distraught after your father's death. Jonas, I'm so sorry. That must have been so hard on you.'
'We can talk about it if you want.'

options.optionText: I want to talk about it
I don't want to talk about it

scenes.text: 'What was it like?'

options.optionText: It was hard, I was so angry at everything and everyone

scenes.text: 'That sounds horrible. I know how close you were to your father'
'I'm so sorry Jonas'

options.optionText: It's okay, I'm glad you're here

scenes.text: 'Ohh okay' Martha looks at you oddly.
'Can I ask you something Jonas?'
'Was what happened between us at the lake at the start of the summer real?' Martha looks away, unsure.
'I think about it a lot.' Martha at you. 'But you were gone all summer, Bartosz was the only one there for me. We're together now. I'm sorry if that makes you uncomfortable.'

options.optionText: I understand, you don't need to explain yourself

scenes.text: 'Thank you' Martha sighs. 'I better go, people will start to wonder where I am'
'Ohh okay' Martha looks disheartened.
'See you around Jonas' Martha walks away.
You wander the forest for a while but find nothing of note.

As you approach the gate entrance to the plant you see a man pull up to the gate in a new Mercedes car. The gate opens for him immediately. As he passes you, he stops and rolls down his window. Alexander Tiedeman leans his head out of the car. 'Hello Jonas, here looking for a job?' He laughs.
'Ohh I'm afraid I can't let you in to walk around Jonas. Nuclear power plants are dangerous places. I'll try and arrange a visit for you sometime in the future.'
'That's great to hear!' remarks Alexander, smiling. 'It's great to see another generation interested in Nuclear energy.'

'Unfortunately, as you've probably heard. The plant is being decommissioned now in a few days.' Alexander sighs. 'The world can no longer stomach the thought of Nuclear power. A shame really, it's one of the few viable options for a clean future.'

options.optionText: What will happen to the plant?
I always thought it was an eyesore in the town

scenes.text: 'It will be decommissioned, and all the staff that it supports will have to be let go. It's very unfortunate.'
'It has provided a living to many in this town over the years, including your mother.' Alexander replies angrily.

'Yes, it really is quite sad' Alexander sounds sad. 'Anyway,  I've lots of things to take care of before the shut down process can begin. Call over sometime, Regina and I bought Bartosz a new console, I'm sure he's dying to have you over to play it.'
'See you around Jonas' Alexander drives through the gates and they shut behind him.
The gates to the plant are shut and there is no other way to enter

You walk along the lake for about a kilometer when you see a familiar face. Bartosz stands by the edge of the lake, skipping stones into the lake's center. He eyes you approaching. 'Hey Jonas, welcome back to crazy town!'
'Sorry, I shouldn't have said crazy town. I didn't mean anything by it!'
'Yeah, sorry about that.' remarks Bartosz, unapologetically. 'We missed you here over the summer man! It was so boring without you!'

options.optionText: What did you get up to?

scenes.text: 'Ohh, so much! Magnus, Martha and I went to a rock concert, we went camping down here by the lake, smoked a lot of pot! Ohh and Martha and I began hooking up!'

'Ohh you don't have to be sarcastic, I know you had a thing for her! I'm sorry man, but you weren't here and one thing lead to another! We'll find you someone soon though, don't sweat it. Ohh and I think Magnus is fucking Francizka, can you believe that?'

options.optionText: Makes sense they've always been eyeing each other

scenes.text: 'I know right! Ohh and I got a new Xbox! You should come over sometime and play Gears of War with me! It might help take your mind off everything!'
'Anyway, I gotta go man, Mama is cooking dinner so I better get home. See you later man!'
You walk the length of the lake and arrive back where you started
As you enter the hospital you immediately recognise a faint but clear sense of death lingering to every surface of the building. As you walk, you notice an open door up ahead.
You peer in the door and see an old man pacing around the room. He hears you enter, qucikly turns to face you. He appears to be mumbling to himself as he approaches you.

As the man approaches you see his face is heavily disfigured. You realize Helge Doppler stands before you. 'It's going to happen again' he whispers softly, directing it at no one in particular. 'It's going to happen again' he repeats.
'Is it already too late?' The man replies.

options.optionText: Is it too late for what?

scenes.text: 'He must be stopped.' The man stutters. 'The children… the children.'

options.optionText: What children? Who must be stopped?

scenes.text: 'The White Devil….. Noah!' The man clenches your shoulders and leans in. 'You must stop him….. You must!'

options.optionText: Who is Noah? What is he going to do?

scenes.text: Before Helge can respond, two nurses appear. 'What are you doing here? You cannot be here, leave immediately!'
'Leave now or I am calling the police!' screams one of the nurses.
You begin walking back down the hall. All the while you hear Helge wailing. 'It's going to happen again! Sic Mundus Creatus Est!'
Visiting hours for the hospital are over.
You enter the retirement home and approach the reception desk. A nurse turns to face you. 'Here to see your grandmother Jonas? She's just down the hall to the right.'
You walk down the familiar hall and come across a familiar door. You knock on it and a few seconds later your grandmother appears at the door. 'Jonas! What a pleasant surprise, please come in!'
'It's so nice to see you! I missed you over the summer, your mother told me you were away for a while. Is everything okay?'

options.optionText: I spent the summer in a psychiatric hospital

scenes.text: 'Ohh' Ines Kahnwald takes your hand in hers. 'I'm sorry to hear that Jonas. I know how sad you were after your father died.'

'I know. Your dad was a wonderful man. I'm glad I got to spend the time with him that I did. You know when he arrived at the hospital, 33 years ago, he was so confused and depressed. He had come such a long way since then.'

options.optionText: You never told me who dad's real parents were
Yeah, I still can't believe what happened

scenes.text: 'I don't know who they were, your father never told me what really happened the day before he arrived. I tried asking him many times but he never wanted to talk about it. I think it still haunted him deep down, maybe that was what caused him to do what he did'
'You should run along deary, find comfort in your friends, in Martha and Magnus and Bartosz.'
'Speaking of which, that Mikkel kid looks more and more like your father did at his age every day!'
Visiting hours for the retirement home are over.
